info.name: Edinger-Westphal nucleus
info.description: The nucleus of Edinger-Westphal contains the pre-ganglionic parasympathetic neurons that contribute to the third or oculomotor cranial nerve.  Located in the midline of the midbrain with the rest of the oculomotor complex of motor neurons, these parasympathetic fibers terminate in the ciliary ganglion.  Post-ganglionic fibers from the ciliary ganglion innervate the constrictors of the pupil and the ciliary muscles.
